name: chronicler
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person who writes descriptions of historical events as they happen: He was a photographer and chronicler of life in the poorest neighbourhoods at the end of the 19th century. Medieval chroniclers worked from monasteries and royal courts, setting down what seemed to be the most important events of the day. See
chronicle
More examplesFewer examplesHe became the world's foremost chronicler of a forgotten civilization known as the Chachapoya.For some years she has been a chronicler of Wyoming's ranchlands.Peter Martyr d'Anghiera was the principal contemporary chronicler of Columbus and other explorers of the 15th century.From 1941 until its closing in 2009, Gourmet magazine was the chronicler of American food trends.
